page.title: 20North Watford Group.
page.content: The research was carried out by 4 schools in the North Watford area in the summer term 1985. Approximately 120 children took part and a large group of parents helped collect the information. The teachers taking part included Maureen Martindale from Holy Rood JM., Gillian Flitt from Walter de Merton (after September 1985 to be known as Beechfield JMI), Ken Heaton from Lea Farm JM and Carol Dunford and Ian Gibson from Parkgate JM. There were two disks made by the group. The BBC disk was edited and typed up by Ken Heaton and his class 4H at Lea Farm School. The RML 480Z disk was edited and typed up by Ian Gibson at Parkgate JM School. Just a thought..Watford had its wettest June for many years whilst we were collecting the information. How was the weather 900 years ago?
